tool_description: Explore the powerful 1001fx-APIs & CryptoFunctions collection that provides you with various cryptographic operations like AES encryption and decryption, hashing using HmacSHA256 or SHA256, and JSON Web Token (JWT) encoding and decoding. Secure your data with API key authorization and benefit from the easy-to-use and flexible functions for your crypto needs. Transform your projects with this comprehensive and secure collection of cryptographic APIs.
name: Crypto 1001 FX Functions
title: Crypto 1001 FX Functions

api_list.name: HmacSHA256
api_list.description: The "HmacSHA256" REST endpoint is an API that computes a message authentication code (MAC) using the HmacSHA256 hash function. To use this endpoint, users must provide a message, secret key, and hash type as inputs. The endpoint then computes the MAC using the specified hash function and secret key, and returns the resulting code as output. This endpoint is useful for verifying the authenticity and integrity of data, as any changes to the message will result in a different MAC. By using a secure secret key, users can ensure that their data is protected from tampering and unauthorized access. The "HmacSHA256" REST endpoint can be integrated into various applications and websites to enhance data security.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://crypto-1001-fx-functions.p.rapidapi.com/crypto/hash"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "crypto-1001-fx-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: JWTDecode
api_list.description: The "JWT Decode" REST endpoint is an API that decodes JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) using a secret key and specified algorithm. To use this endpoint, users must provide the JWT as an input. The endpoint then decodes the JWT using the specified algorithm and secret key, and returns the resulting payload as output. The input to this endpoint is a JSON object that contains the encoded JWT. The decoded payload can include information such as user ID, access privileges, and expiration date. The "JWT Decode" REST endpoint can be integrated into authentication and authorization systems to verify the authenticity of incoming requests and ensure that only authorized users can access protected resources.

api_list.name: JWTEncode
api_list.description:
The "JWT Encode" REST endpoint is a software API that allows users to encode data into JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) using a secret key. To use this endpoint, users must provide a payload, a secret key, and the algorithm to be used for encoding.

Once the endpoint receives this information, it will use the specified algorithm to encode the provided payload using the specified secret key.

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: AESEncrypt
api_list.description: The "AES Encrypt" endpoint is an API that encrypts data using the AES algorithm. Users provide the plaintext message, secret key, and cryptographic type as inputs, and receive the encrypted ciphertext as output. This endpoint is useful for securely encrypting sensitive information, and can be integrated into various applications and websites to enhance data security.

api_list.name: AESDecrypt
api_list.description: The "AES Decrypt" endpoint is an API that decrypts data encrypted using the AES algorithm. Users provide the ciphertext, secret key, and cryptographic type as inputs, and receive the decrypted plaintext as output. This endpoint is useful for securely decrypting sensitive information, and can be integrated into various applications and websites to enhance data security.
